courses.subject: WOHS
courses.title: Women’s Health: Social Cultural Determinants and International Perspectives
courses.description: This course will provide a framework to discuss public health issues and determinants of health for women. The course will highlight key issues such as gender inequalities in health; to cultural and societal role of women and health provision and policy. Topical discussion will include important issues such as unwanted pregnancies, sexually transmitted infections, female genital mutilation and cancer screening.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Public Health
courses.course_syllabus:
| Introduction to Women’s Health, Gender as a determinant of health |
| --- |
| Gender analysis, empowerment and gender mainstreaming |
| Self Directed Learning/ Presentation Preparation |
| Nutrition and Women’s health |
| Presentation |
| Health Services and Policies in women’s health |
| Gender, sexuality and health |
| Media and Women’s Body Image |
courses.required_readings:
Women and Health. Today’s evidence, tomorrow’s agenda. WHO (Exec Summary)

<http://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/10665/70119/1/WHO_IER_MHI_STM.09.1_eng.pdf>

The World’s women 2010: Trends and Statistics (Asia Pacific)

<http://unstats.un.org/unsd/demographic/products/Worldswomen/FactSheet2010.pdf>

Women, Health and Development Program. Fact sheet

<http://www1.paho.org/english/DPM/GPP/GH/GEHFactSheet.pdf>

Non-Communicable Diseases and Gender

<http://www.paho.org/hq/index.php?option=com_docman&task=doc_view&gid=14907&Itemid>=
courses.recommended_readings:
Women and Health. Today’s evidence, tomorrow’s agenda. WHO (Full report)

<http://www.who.int/gender/women_health_report/full_report_20091104_en.pdf>

Women and health: The key for sustainable development. The lancet commissions. <http://www.thelancet.com/pdfs/journals/lancet/PIIS0140-6736(15)60497-4.pdf>

courses.subject: WOHS
courses.title: Common Health Conditions of Women
courses.description: This course will provide a framework to discuss public health issues and determinants of health for women, particularly midlife and beyond. The course will highlight challenges to women during menopausal transition and the development of commonly encountered health problems from midlife onwards. Public health approach in preventive strategies for common health problems during this life stage will also be emphasized.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Public Health
courses.learning_outcomes:
On completion of this module, students should be able to:

- review the risk of common conditions affecting women, particularly the midlife and older women and issues related to the prevention, diagnosis and management strategies.
courses.course_syllabus:
| Introduction to Course and assignment Menopausal transition, symptoms and related health issues |
| --- |
| Musculoskeletal conditions: osteoporosis, osteoarthritis |
| Cardiovascular risks in women Obesity and metabolic syndrome in women |
| Soy intake and women’s health Discussion of presentation topics |
| Epidemiology of Breast cancer Breast cancer management and predictors of survival |
| Mental well-being Anxiety and depression in women |
| Alzheimer’s disease Care giver burden |
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the course outline provided by course teacher

courses.subject: WOHS
courses.title: Reproductive Health Issues of Women
courses.description: This course will cover issues and common health problems of women of reproductive age.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Public Health
courses.learning_outcomes:
On completion of this module, students should be able to:

- explore and understand women’s health issues related to reproductive health.

courses.subject: WOHS
courses.title: Common Mental Health Conditions of Women
courses.description: This course will enable students to gain in depth understanding of the mental health issues of women from self esteem and mental disorders.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Public Health
courses.learning_outcomes:
On completion of this module, students should be able to:

- explore and understand issues regarding mental health issues in women.
courses.course_syllabus: Please refer to the course outline provided by course teacher
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the course outline provided by course teacher

courses.subject: WOHS
courses.title: Research Project and Report
courses.description: Each student is required to complete an individual research project in the field of women’ s health under supervision. Students will be required to make progress reports via presentations as well as writing up report to form the master thesis.
